metadata.title: USN-7243-1 -- VLC vulnerability
metadata.description: It was discovered that VLC incorrectly handled memory when reading an MMS stream. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service or execute arbitrary code.  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-7243-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  libvlc-bin - 3.0.8-0ubuntu18.04.1+esm3 libvlc-dev - 3.0.8-0ubuntu18.04.1+esm3 libvlc5 - 3.0.8-0ubuntu18.04.1+esm3 libvlccore-dev - 3.0.8-0ubuntu18.04.1+esm3 libvlccore9 - 3.0.8-0ubuntu18.04.1+esm3 vlc - 3.0.8-0ubuntu18.04.1+esm3 vlc-bin - 3.0.8-0ubuntu18.04.1+esm3 vlc-data - 3.0.8-0ubuntu18.04.1+esm3 vlc-l10n - 3.0.8-0ubuntu18.04.1+esm3 vlc-plugin-access-extra - 3.0.8-0ubuntu18.04.1+esm3 vlc-plugin-base - 3.0.8-0ubuntu18.04.1+esm3 vlc-plugin-fluidsynth - 3.0.8-0ubuntu18.04.1+esm3 vlc-plugin-jack - 3.0.8-0ubuntu18.04.1+esm3 vlc-plugin-notify - 3.0.8-0ubuntu18.04.1+esm3 vlc-plugin-qt - 3.0.8-0ubuntu18.04.1+esm3 vlc-plugin-samba - 3.0.8-0ubuntu18.04.1+esm3 vlc-plugin-skins2 - 3.0.8-0ubuntu18.04.1+esm3 vlc-plugin-svg - 3.0.8-0ubuntu18.04.1+esm3 vlc-plugin-video-output - 3.0.8-0ubuntu18.04.1+esm3 vlc-plugin-video-splitter - 3.0.8-0ubuntu18.04.1+esm3 vlc-plugin-visualization - 3.0.8-0ubuntu18.04.1+esm3 vlc-plugin-zvbi - 3.0.8-0ubuntu18.04.1+esm3 Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro
